Specific Details: Regnum reached out to all local councillors in the Ardee Municipal District, to inform them of a proposed solar farm development that has not yet been submitted to planning in the townlands of Mooremount, Knockatober, Painestown, Dromin, Knockdinnin, Ballymageragh and Cangy.
DPOs Lobbied: Kevin Callan|Councillor|Louth County council::Pearse McGeough|Councillor|Louth County council::Paula Butterly|Councillor|Louth County council::John Sheridan|Councillor|Louth County council::Jim Tenanty|Councillor|Louth County council::Dolores Minogue|Councillor|Louth County council::Bernie Conlon|Councillor|Louth County council
Subject Matter: Regnum reached out to all local councillors in the Ardee Municipal District, to inform them of a proposed solar farm development that has not yet been submitted to planning in the townlands of Mooremount, Knockatober, Painestown, Dromin, Knockdinnin, Ballymageragh and Cangy.
Intended Results: The intention was to introduce Regnum Renewables and to inform the councillors of the proposal before meeting with local residents in the area. This was to ensure that the councillors were aware of the project and could pass on any concerns directly to Regnum.
Lobbying Activities: Kevin Daly (COO) and Michael O'Sullivan (CEO) met with Cllr. Jim Tenanty, Cllr. Dolores Minogue, Cllr. Bernie Conlon and Cathaoirleach of Louth County Council Kevin Callan on 01/10/2024 in a meeting in Ardee, to introduce both Regnum and the proposed development. |Meeting|1::Kevin Daly (COO) and Michael O'Sullivan (CEO) met with Cllr. Pearse McGeough in Ardee on 01/10/2024 to introduce both Regnum and the proposed development. |Meeting|1::Emails and calls exchanged with Cllr. John Sheridan and Cllr. Paula Butterly to try to arrange a meeting with the councillors to discuss the project, although it never materialised.  |Email|6-10::Michael O'Sullivan (CEO) had exchanged emails with the Cathaoirleach of Louth County Council Kevin Callan, sharing project information such as maps and layouts on 07/10/24.  |Email|2-5::Texts were exchanged and phone calls attempted, arranging to meet and providing project details between Michael O'Sullivan (CEO) and Cathaoirleach of Louth County Council Kevin Callan  on 01/10/24 and 10/10/24. |Phone call|2-5
